review_blob: This is the best IPA out of Sweden at the moment (or maybe ever). Every bit of ingredient builds up to a beautiful balance! Olle if you will continue with this amazing work, the future for Swedens development within craftbeer is safe!

Had this beer several times at different bars and at home. The beer itself is a bit strange, you get what they aimed for but the problem for me is that the style is not really my thing. A bit harsh down the throat, sourness is definitely there. You get some roasted flavors as well, and here is the problem, the roasted malts is not a perfect pairing with the sourness for me. 

I have to mention the label! The label is so incredibly slick, just perfect, a apple for my eye. one of my favorite labels!

Had this beer 2014 at Moeder Lambic in Brussels. The beer is really something special. With the flat texture and the full flavor of a gueuze this was a beer i tasted a few times (in between the cantillon casks). Viscosity is not something i would say was heavy but i still would say that the beer had a mouth coating fell to it. flavor wise it was mostly wood and different citrus zest aromas.

Tap at Akkurat. Nice but a bit heavy for me, the nice lively sparkling lambic was absent, this was more toward a heavy grand cru lambic that im not sure that i liked. The beer had some boon like character, the heavy musty hay aromas and flavors that was not for me 100% of the way.

Bottle at Akkurat season 15/16 cork. A slightly cloudy beer with a light amber color, totally flat with no bubbles what so ever! Aroma consists of a few spices including coriander seeds, fennel seed and onion powder. The beer got a big mouth coating mouth feel, slightly thick (for a lambic). I can feel both the Oude lambic and the Iris in this blend! The smoothness of lambic and the tartness of Iris. The taste is long lasting with a lot of cognac notes, red apple pur in the mouth but quickly fading to give away to a hay flavour.

I tried this beer at the brewery the day it was bottled! Back then it had a interesting balance between the roasted stout aromas and the lambic flavors. There where some notes of chocolate blended with the freshness of lambic. and then there where a lot of dried grass, hay. I was surprised when the taste of the beer where more of a normal gueuze, still there where some coffee notes lingering in the aftertaste.

Thanks Jean for this, this beer was decanted by Jean for me and Manker. Due to this the beer opened up in flavors and aroma. You could really tell the difference during the time we drank this interesting and fabulous creation. the Chardonnay must that this beer was made with was from a Belgian producer close to the border of France. The beer it self was a tart thing, you get the must upfront and in the back, i guess that this beer was uncomplicated and unbalanced for being a Cantillon beer. There was a big flavor of grape skin even tough the beer was made with must. Tough to get your hands on but i would somehow say it is a table beer, just a everyday beer to your food! unkoplicatad but still amazing!

Thank you Jean, my life would not be as interesting without your experiments!

Bottle at Cantillon, there are almost no bottles left. 

Where do you start? Terribly complex in both aroma and taste. It was like walking around in a maze and every time you found a new corridor, there was a new flavor and/or aroma. Making a lambic with a wine that is as good and complex, you get the result will be absolutely stunning!

When I first got glass in my hand thanks to Jean Van Roy, I began to unfurl all the aromas, there was raw celery and fennel, star anise, black pepper, almonds, high alcohols, cumin, nutmeg, sweet licorice.

The flavor contained most of the components I described earlier as aromas but with an emphasis on celery and fennel. For the aroma i would say that the curry flavor where the more dominant.

At cantillon 75 bottle. 

The aroma of the beer had many different aromas but there were mostly a unripe "greenness", Green unripe fruits and foliage of carrot and/or beetroot was there and danced around in the nose. Also the smell of the spice "aromat" was present. 

A slight taste of rubber band that disappeared after a while when the heat of the glass steps. one could find some wild strawberries and much violets in the aftertaste. The beer tasted most out of strawberry caramel, or rather toffe with strawberry flavor. Spicy artificial cherries were also there in the backround taste

75 bottle at cantillon. 

A fantastic beer with a lot of depths that tastes as if it has a bone in each trench. It is not easy to fully determine what is good, what is great and what is perfect. I would not say that it is sprawling, but it has something about it that feels uncertain. A fantastic opportunity to try this unprecedented different beer, that is still etched in my memory.

A extreme elegance with lots of citrus! Lime in some degree but especially lemon! But most of all there where mandarins! The taste of Mandarin (a little orange citrus fruit) makes this Cantillon beer step up to something different from all other Cantillon beers I have tried, a sweet orange taste but still sour all the way, its hard to explain. But there where apricots, lots of them as well, so much of different winy fruits! The flavor tends to sour candies that I ate at my grandmothers house as a child with a fantastic fresh rolling acidity and fresh fruit flavor. lovely!

This beer is so moderately acidic, and i dont find that in old lambic if it is not Cantillon. Perhaps above all on should speak of the elegance in the sourness that only comes with old Cantillon! An oxidation that makes one think of dusty cellar! The taste of green apple peel but a flavor the meat from red apples, complex is the least one can say!

A beautiful moment when I got to try this nectar with the color of red gummi bears, so clear but still difficult to see through, beautiful. Regarding the taste, so the first thing I noticed was the saltiness of the beer. The beer has a distinct character of iris whole malt but while it was more elegant, the cherries were there keeping the beer in balance. there was, as I said saltiness in the beer, but there was also a spiciness from the cherries that made it to "salt and pepper" beer, making this beer at a great food beer!

Jean, I hope your son was happy for the beer for it is noticeable that you made it with love! amazing!
UPDATED: MAY 15, 2014
Bittert popcorn! That is all i can say Amazing time To try it but it's all just buttery popcorn lambic! Drinkable!!
UPDATED: MAY 3, 2014
beer_name: Cantillon / Allagash / Russian River Wild Friendship Blend

review_blob: Cask on Moeder. a nice red-ish color. spicy cherries. with a rose pepper taste, lots of pure cherries in the glass, very nice indeed!

Cask at Moeder and from barrel at the brewery. Very nice tasting with a hint of popcorn and butter. kind of interesting taste. and goes down pint after pint. my favorite "regular" of the casks at moeder!
Cask at moeder! Lovely color to a somewhat nice beer. the sweet flavored lambic is good but not amazing, probably mostly because of the style and not the maker or anything like that.
Cask at Moeder Fonteinas. Lovely aroma with a "spicy" touch. Almost like having some scoville in the beer without being hot. as it should some raspberry flavors. but not very balanced or elegant.

Well this beer was interesting. A little carbonation even tough it's supposed to be still. A huge horse blanket aroma. Taste is a 3fonteimen vintage geuze like taste a bit caramel even tough is totally dry. Good but not the greatest

Growler From mikkeller bar. tasted august 2013. it got a bit too much of fire in the aroma and taste, alcohol is a bit too much present. Al tough the calvados is beautiful in its own but here it feels a bit like the poured a shot of calvados in to the beer instead of aging it with the beer. that said its one of the best beers ive had from boon, always fun with experimental beers.
simple straight on apple flavors. apple juice is what it is, and i like apple juice. sweet! enough said

bottle at home. a nice bottle although it gives me the chills due to the sound it gives when you touch it (= lesser good experience) taste is similar to the regular Boon Geuzes. funky non sour, with a huge horse blanket aroma. nothing special but fun to try.

Jean Chris label 750ml bottle. Mixed flavors and aromas. i picked out a very small smoky flavor. (although i was the only one who smelled that in the group) nice taste of green apples. And the skin of red berries. Wine was there but way in the back. overall a good beer! And thanks Dan for sharing!

375 bottle at Pressklubben. the aroma is lemon zest with the pith. heavy peel aroma. with some murky notes from the lambic. taste wise there is not much sourness at all. but the pith and zest is there. if you try a lemon caramel and take away all the sweetness and sourness this is the result taste wise.
A nice pink color with some bubbles. bottle from 1993 at Pressklubben. oxidized aroma and flavor of dirt and earth. blended with a sweetness that doesnt play for the beers favor in flavor.
Old Bottle at Pressklubben. Label says that the beers best before 2004. a nice mild lingering cassis flavor with a sweet note.

Sample from growler. 

The amber lambic got a aroma of candid apples. Somewhat the aroma of a barley wine. The oak is forward, and pushes me to think of a bourbon. Harsh sourness in the back of the mouth, thats not so nice, but smother on the front of the tongue.

The red label feestbier. Cork 2005. 

Cloudy appearance, with a nice hint of gooseberry. Clear taste of the berries and a distinct sour taste. Some plastic phenolic notes that disturbed the beer it self.
heavy peach aroma and taste. it more of a soda then a beer. its perfect to drink when you have had a lot of beers the same day! very non complex!
weird beer. not so good. i dont like the artificial taste thats in the beer.
a sweet oud bruin, with a sour feeling that dont work with the sweetness. tart, sweet and sour in the throat and only sour in the throat! not very nice!
good cherry flavors. intense cherry with a almond finish. other stone fruits are present. this is a cheap way to get my fix of kriek beers! very good indeed!
this is a ok geuze but the overripe apples mixed with the barnyard in this one does not hit the mark for me. strange geuze.
sweet and not that nice! faro isnt the greatest style out there but this is not a good example of what it should be according to me!
The sweetness is very off for me. i dont like no saccharine in my beers. regular or do a good thing with the sweetness! not very fond of this one.

This brew reminds me so much of my grandmothers cassis squash its ridiculous, and thats probably why i like it so much! taste is no where close to a cantillon or nothing like a traditional lambic. but since its so drinkable and low ABV ill give it a good rating!
a nice underrated Geuze! cheap available and a good example of what it can be! this is one of my standard Geuzes! sour funky barnyardy etc (all the classic things!)

is it good or not? since the beer is more towards soda with a peach flavor and aroma. its hard to rate. do you rate it for what it tastes like or for what lambic it is? i would say as a flavored lambic it very nice. nothing like a traditional lambic. very drinkable and nice from time to time!

Huge Thanks to Danko for sharing, and thanks to Skrubbe for the second and the third bottle!. amazing Lambic/Geuze/Loerik! nice berry aromas, tastes towards the recurrent berries and some stone fruit! this is very good!

Tap at Akkurat during release. 

Aroma consists of canned mushrooms and some strange grassy note, almost like molded hay. 
the beer tasted of when you bite into a dandelion strain (as i did when younger) horribly bitter taste and it didnt let go of my tongue. a continuously taste of plant sap. horrible. this experiment didnt go to my liking. the best way to describe this beer is when some guy tells you that this is his first home brew its a DIPA and its 9 months old! infected thats what it taste.
UPDATED: NOV 21, 2013

375ml Bottle with a 2005 cork.

thank you bearded guy in the bar at one pint pub for the opportunity!
this is the clearest of all the lambics i have ever tried! superbly clear in appearance and with a nice apple juice color to it. aroma was funky sour berry with a soapy smell like you just washed your hands with violets!? the flavor reminded me of the skin of berries, and of course the taste of lambic.

375ml Botlle cork 2009.

awesome to try this beer, thanks to pikkulintu who gave me the chance (for two bottles)! a small frothy head that stayed for a while.
aroma was spot on with vanilla vs the lambic sourness and complexity add to that a cured meat or the smell prosciutto and you have the aroma of it. taste wise i tasted the bourbon and therefor vanilla and some nice ripe red apples that lingered in the mouth as an aftertaste. amazing beer!

375ml Bottle cork 2006. blue label.

awesome to try this beer, thanks to pikkulintu that gave me the chance to try this brew! had the two of this at the bar with some friends! the aroma was a nice funky lambic with big star fruit aromas! some sweetness yet tart and that followed in the taste of the beer! it was tart and somewhat sweet, star fruit here also! very nice brew! hope to try it again but probably never will..

750ml bottle caped and corked!

nice berry character to it, fairly nice acidity. cloudy is a bluish red
750ml Shelton bottle, vintage 2010. so this beer has developed a whole lot since it was released. this is a good example of what a perfect wild ale would taste like! underrated loon!
beer_name: Cantillon Zwanze (2010) Blanche de Quenast BHV

review_blob: bottle thanks to eric! very barley wine like although there is a lot that reminds me of a cantillon geuze or lambic. its not sweet and still not sour so somewhere in between! Schizophrenic!
UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014
